intro: Minuartia strandjensis, commonly known as the Norwegian rock-cress, is a low-growing, mat-forming flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has small, bright yellow or white flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are usually small, fleshy, and arranged in a rosette. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or coastal areas. Minuartia strandjensis is adapted to cold climates and can survive in harsh environmental conditions.
